title: Understanding Tolerance
text: Tolerance occurs when a person needs to consume more of a substance to achieve the same effect. This happens because the body adapts to the substance over time.

title: Effects of Tolerance
text: As tolerance develops, the person may not feel the same effects from the substance as they did initially, leading them to increase their intake.

hintAnswer: The neurotransmitters adapt, leading to a reduced response to the substance.
title: Identifying Tolerance
text: What happens to the neurotransmitters when a person continues to use substances?
choices: The neurotransmitters adapt, leading to a reduced response to the substance.
The neurotransmitters become more sensitive, leading to an increased response to the substance.
The neurotransmitters remain unchanged, maintaining the same response to the substance.

hintAnswer: The person requires more of the substance to feel an effect.
title: Recognizing Tolerance
text: What is the result of neurotransmitter adaptation in terms of substance use?
choices: The person requires more of the substance to feel an effect.
The person requires less of the substance to feel an effect.
The person feels the same effect with the same amount of substance.
